definition: thin piece/flake/a slice/film/TV play/to slice/to carve thin/partial/incomplete/one-sided/classifier for slices, tablets, tract of land, area of water/classifier for CDs, movies, DVDs etc/used with numeral 一[yi1]: classifier for scenario, scene, feeling, atmosphere, sound etc/Kangxi radical 91
variant of 人[ren2]/"person" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 10), occurring in 兒, 兀, 兄 etc
erhua variant of 恐怖片[kong3 bu4 pian4]

sentences.english: And she broke it in little pieces, now how do you do?
sentences.chinese: 然后被她碎成小片儿，现在感觉如何？

sentences.english: An egg-white spinach omelet with sliced avocado and some whole-grain toast will do the trick!
sentences.chinese: 蛋白菠菜蛋卷外加鳄梨片儿和全麦土司最好了。

sentences.english: Is it me, or is he just lost in that area?
sentences.chinese: 我怎么觉得他是在那片儿地区迷路了呢。

sentences.english: When the lid came off the box, loose papers drifted out.
sentences.chinese: 箱子盖掉了，纸片儿撒了出来。

definition: variant of 人[ren2]/"person" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 10), occurring in 兒, 兀, 兄 etc
erhua variant of 飯館|饭馆[fan4 guan3]
short note/slip of paper/stripe/(slang) cop/(old) prostitute
tube-shaped object/tube/bobbin/(Internet slang) homonym for 同志[tong2 zhi4]
erhua variant of 哥們|哥们[ge1 men5]
erhua variant of 爆肚[bao4 du3]
hot pot/a dish where thinly sliced meat and vegetables are boiled briefly in a broth and then served with dipping sauces
